intro: Phebalium stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically visited by nectar-feeding insects and birds. It is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in heathland and coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
